summary: This is an email chain from March 6, 2019, within the U.S. Department of Justice. The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) forwards a letter from an attorney representing Jean Luc Brunel, a former associate of Jeffrey Epstein, to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The letter offers information, including details of obstruction of justice, related to the SDNY's Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: He is the client of an attorney who sent a letter to the DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility, offering to provide information including details of obstruction of justice related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He is the central figure in the investigation being conducted by the SDNY. Jean Luc Brunel is identified as his former associate.

connections.description: Brunel is described as a 'former associate' of Jeffrey Epstein in connection with the matters under investigation by the SDNY.

events.title: OPR Refers Brunel's Offer to SDNY
events.description: The DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility forwards a letter from Jean Luc Brunel's attorney to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter offers to provide information, including 'details of obstruction of justice,' related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: In March 2019, Jean Luc Brunel, through his attorney, offered to provide information to the DOJ regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The offered information specifically included 'details of obstruction of justice.'

The DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility received the offer but declined to act on it, stating it was unrelated to their investigation and instead referred it to the SDNY prosecutors investigating Epstein.
